result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonia Nmi Mendoza Contreras was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 1:15pm{ MO & MK]
Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Antonia Nmi Mendoza Contreras in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish interpretor.

On Motion of the State  the Court amends both  Counts #1 and #2 to Class A misdemeanor theft contray to statutes 943.20(1) and 943.20(3)(a).
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No contact with: Brenda Cortina
--No use of another person's personal identifying information
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge



Days credit for time already served: 29  days
recess:2:02pm

Case recalled at 4:12 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Antonia Nmi Mendoza Contreras in court, in-custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that she was able to speak with Ms. Mendoza Contreras's immigration attorney and was informed that proposed agreement will pose immigration issues. Renews bond modifcation request, presents basis.
ADA Beck: Did speak with ADA Hall and she is not contesting modification, with conditions

Court grants motion to modify bond and requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
-Not leave State of Wisconsin
-No contact with Brenda Cortina
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-Not possess or use any person's personally identifying information except her own
-Maintain regular and on-going contact with Atty Dahnert
Recess: 4:19 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 1/7/15 at 3:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC 2/6/15 at 1:15 pm - Send notices

Case called at 1:34 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Antonia Nmi Mendoza Contreras in court with attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Atty Dahnert: Have tentative resolution of case, but need to discuss with immigration attorney prior to proceeding. Did get potential plea/sentencing date of 12.30.14, but just found out that the immigration hold has been lifted. Orally motions to modify bond, presents basis. If Court will not consider bond modification, would request to recall case later this afternoon.
Court informs Atty Dahnert that It would prefer to hold matter over and address later this afternoon. If can not proceed this afternoon, will proceed on oral motion to modify bond
ADA Beck: Presents concerns re: oral bond modification, no objection to holding over to later today to attempt to address
Recess: 1:41 pm

case called at 1:17pm. [MK]
Defendant Antonia Mendoza Contreras appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Ms. Mendoza Contreras verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause exists in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000 cash bond, with conditions:
--not to use or possess any other person's identifying information
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin. 
recess 1:28 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/26/14 at 9:40am  (2) schedule Status Conference after the Pretrial date--JA please note in comments that case is at Preliminary Hearing stage  [Defendant remains JCJ on both this cash bail requirement and an ICE hold)
